It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dense, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, and it is known for its alkaloid content, including cocaine. Psychotria trichostoma thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, temperate climates. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and economically important in certain regions.
